intro: Agrostemma decumbens, commonly known as the downy scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, white hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Its flowers are small, pale blue to purple, and arranged in loose clusters at the ends of the stems. Agrostemma decumbens is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
